intro: Cleome pentaphylla var. hirsuta, commonly known as hairy cleome, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its varietal name. The plant produces clusters of showy, pink to red flowers that bloom throughout the summer. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
